conclusion: Ball is acted on by weight mg downward and drag force λ mg upward, net downward force is (1 – λ) mg.
Ball falls from rest through distance H.
Using v² = 2 a s, speed just before impact u = √[2(1 – λ)g H].
Ball rises after bounce through distance h until momentarily at rest.
Using v² – (post-collision speed)² = 2(–a)h, v′ = √[2(1 – λ)g h].
Coefficient of restitution r is defined as the ratio of rebound speed v′ to impact speed u.
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is v′ / u = √(h / H).
